name: SEO: Works Every Time
content:
So I received an internal email at work the other day about how we could SEO our company website (). Here was my suggestion: > “Just put up a few

tags that state (in this order) Rails, Coding, Consulting, Porn, Free Porn, Porn on Rails, Viagra, iPhone, development, hot chicks, elc. > > Guaranteed hits!” Genius right? So after a while, a fellow employee ([@maxmurphy][1]) suggested we implement this rails solution: 
<code class=’ruby’>["Rails", "Coding", "Consulting", "Porn", "Free Porn", "Porn on Rails", "Viagra",
"iPhone", "development", "hot chicks", "elc"].each do |seo|
  "#{seo} \n ELC ROCKS #{seo}"
end</code>
Perfect! Feel free to steal this and you too can be an SEO Guru!
Tweet
[1]: http://twitter.com/maxmurphy
title: SEO: Works Every Time
